titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the California business records, 1918-1932 JL023
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Processed by PW; machine-readable finding aid created by Steven Mandeville-Gamble

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2009-08-03T16:35-0700
profiledesc.langusage: Finding aid is written in English.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection includes papers regarding W.L. Comyn and Co. (1927), which deal with determination of the company's financial situation; the California Bank history chart, which lists California banks, the dates of organization, and whether they were liquidated or taken over by a larger institution; H.N. Stronck Co. instructional booklets on examination of banking institutions; and minutes of the Capitol Issues Committee (1918).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] California business records, JL023, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Received by the Jackson Library of Business from various sources. Transferred to Special Collections in 1979.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains business reports and correspondence re: the re-organization and reformation of the W.L. Comyn Company, 1927-1928.

did.unittitle: History of mergers, absorptions, and purchases of prominent banks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains long list of banks which were consolidated into Farmers & Merchants, Security 1st National Bank, Bank of America, Citizen's National Bank, California Bank, and Union Bank and Trust Co.

did.unittitle: Unmarked black, looseleaf notebook from H.N. Stronck Co.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains two publications entitled: Bank Administration, Earning Power Examinations of Banks and Illustrations of the Method of Attack Employed in Conducting "Earning Power Examinations" in Smaller Banks with an index.

did.unittitle: Bank of Kalamazoo, Earning Power Examination,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains report of examination by H.N. Stronck Co., consultants to banks, bankers, and their commercial clients, Chicago.

did.unittitle: Regular meetings of Capital Issues Committee,

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Committee met in Washington, D.C. daily. Members to Commitee include: Charles Hamlin, Frederick Delano, John Skelton Williams, Frederick Goff, Henry Flower, John Drum, James Brown.

did.unittitle: Regular meetings of Capital Issues Committee, Nos. 69-142 included.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Committee met in Washington, D.C. daily. Members to Commitee include: Charles Hamlin, Frederick Delano, John Skelton Williams, Frederick Goff, Henry Flower, John Drum, James Brown.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains prints and text discussing members and genealogy of the Massachusetts families named in the title.

physdesc.extent: Large, blue ledger. "White Front" written faintly on cover. No other identifying marks or words.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Contains entries of figures and tabulations.
